intro: Trichantha dissimilis, commonly known as the false sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a small, mat-forming perennial that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has small, opposite, ovate leaves and produces tiny, white or pale blue flowers clustered in dense inflorescences. It is adapted to dry conditions with a succulent stem and reduced leaves to minimize water loss. Trichantha dissimilis is often found in rocky soils and is characteristic of Mediterranean and coastal regions.
